title: Who actually played the guitar in Back to the Future? - Quora

response.answer_text: I did, but I didn’t take credit for it. I’m not a fame whore, so to speak. Oh, wait, wrong movie, I did all of Woodstock, that’s right ;-)Sadly, I actually used to know this, then I got old. Puerto Rican Rum most likely killed the brain cells that held that information. Seriously, though, that’s not on Wiki or IDMB? I would think it’d be on one of those. I take a look and see if I can find a reminder. Does Google not work any longer? I seriously wouldn’t be surprised to tell the truth.So, it looks like Fox played it, in synch after learning it from Paul Hanson. At least that was the first answer I could find that was confirmed by a second source. So, Mike Fox played it and then acted it out it like he’d learned. Not bad, I’m fairly impressed.

Michael J. Fox played it for real in that movie. Paul Hanson tutored him how to play it. As for his mannerisms while playing it, he took clues from the on stage mannerisms of Chuck Berry (duh!), Jimi Hendrix, and Pete Townshend. By the way that guitar was a Gibson ES-345 with the Varitone system and it's bridge replaced with a Bigsby vibrato.
